did.unittitle: Women's Progress Club of Washington prayer books
did.abstract: Collection include two prayer books of the "Women's Progress Club of Washington, D.C." The club was founded in 1937 and Sylvia Fisher (1910-1981), was president from 1956-57. The club was dedicated to raising funds for cancer research.

prefercite.head: Preferred citation
prefercite.p: Women's Progress Club of Washington prayer books, Special Collections and University Archives, The George Washington University.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Beverly Fisher, daughter of the prayer book's creator Sylvia Fisher, donated the two prayer books to the University Archives in July of 1992.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Fisher family had an affiliation with the School of Medicine and Health Sciences.

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Materials in this collection include two prayer books of the "Women's Progress Club of Washington, D.C." The club was founded in 1937 and Sylvia Fisher (1910-1981), was president from 1956-57. The club was dedicated to raising funds for cancer research. She created prayer books to which people made donations as a way of honoring the births, marriages, anniversaries, and deaths of loved ones. The club raised money for equipment at the George Washington Hospital and supported it for many years. The materials range in date from 1961-1991.

arrangement.head: Collection Organization
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into one series of scrapbooks.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Prayer book with front cover incription "In Memory of Jack Lyons." Contains memorials to loved ones, with letter from Calvin Klopp, George Washington University Hospital and obituary of Sylvia Fisher.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Prayer book with front cover "Volume II." Contains birth, marriage, anniversary, and death commemorations. Also has an obituary and two photos of Sylvia Fisher.
